column1: Kata Robata////2) Amazing food-I was a bit hesitant to come because of all the hype. Especially given Houston's lively food scene
column2: it's easy for restaurants' brand to overshadow the actual quality of the food. But Kata Robata's wide variety of dishes and deep
column3: complex flavors held up and surpassed reviews. We ordered the homemade shumai
column5: spicy tuna and Rising Sun signature rolls
column9: and green tea cake. I know--it sounds like a lot
column10: but each dish had its own flavor profile that showcased simple ingredients. No heavy sauces
column12: or cluttered plating. The chefs carefully handled each component of the dish
column13: and used lighter (usually ponzu-based) sauces to cut heavier courses.
